thread.title: ‘Girl Waits With Gun,’ by Amy Stewart
thread.title_full: ‘Girl Waits With Gun,’ by Amy Stewart - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Alexis Coe
title: ‘Girl Waits With Gun,’ by Amy Stewart
text:
Historic newspapers are treasure chests laden with booby traps. Every page is full of leads that have the potential to better a project, or completely derail it. Author Amy Stewart has been on the winning side of that tenuous battle until she encountered a series of New York Times headlines like, “‘Oh, for a Chance to Shoot at the Nasty Prowlers!’ The Misses Kopp, Maintaining Siege in Home, Would Just Love to Turn Guns on Blackmailers.” A 1914 car-and-buggy collision cost her a day’s worth of research, but it was no loss. “The Drunken Botanist,” the book she was writing at the time, went on to be a bestseller, and her indulgence provided an answer to an often disquieting question every published author is asked on a near daily basis: What’s the next book about?
